metadata.synopsis: It's Christmas Eve, the day before John (David Arquette) -- a Los Angeles street prostitute -- turns 21. He's hoping to scrape together the cash to spend his birthday in a plush hotel, but, when his money is stolen while he sleeps in a park, John's plans fall apart. Suddenly, he's trying to stave off local gangster Jimmy the Warlock (Terrence Dashon Howard), hoping to calm down his speed-head girlfriend (Alanna Ubach) and dealing with the affections of a wide-eyed young hustler (Lukas Haas).

reviews: Gritty, grim and not wholly believable
A random, but likable knock-off of a Gus Van Sant picture.
Although far from perfect, johns is an edgy and powerful motion picture.

David Arquette and Lukas Haas find the right note for their characters: They have plans and dreams, but vague ones, and they're often sort of detached, maybe because their lives are on hold in between johns.
